result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshawa Nelson Bayless

records.addlTxt: for a pretrial conference 11/18/22 at 11:30 A.M. and return date 12/20/22 at 9:00 A.M.

3:30 PM Defendant Joshawa Nelson Bayless in court.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to atty recited, Defendant would like counsel, matter to be reset, Court makes good cause finding to waive time limits,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Standard felony conditions
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.
Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license.

1:14 PM Defendant Joshawa Nelson Bayless appeared by video, in custody from Columbia County jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Joshawa Nelson Bayless.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. waived reading of criminal complaint, right to attorney recited, $2,000.00 signature bond, standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. enforced time limits for preliminary hearing. 1:25 PM
Preliminary Hearing October 5, 2022 at 3:00 PM
